div.l: But sooth pley quade pley as þe Flemyng seith
And ther͗e for harry bayly be thy feith
Be thowe nat wroth or we departyn̄ here
Thogh that my tale be of an hostelere
But nethirles I wol nat tel hit yit
But or we depart I wis þowe shalt be quyt
And ther͗e with al he lowȝe and made chere
And seid his tale as yee shul aftir͗e here
Here endith the Koke his prollog
A prentise whylom dwellid in this Cete
Of a craft of vittellers was he
A gaylard he was as Goldsmyth in þe shawe
Broun as a bery and a ꝓpropir short felawe
With lokkis blak I kembit ful fetously
Daunce he cowd þat wel and Iolely
For he was clepid Perkyn reveloure
He was as ful of love and paramour
